content: Tragic. ++http://ca.news.yahoo.com/s/afp/090524/world/entertainment_morocco_music_disaster quote: 11 killed in stampede at world music festival in Morocco Sun May 24, 1:46 PM RABAT (AFP) - A stampede at a world music festival in Morocco's capital Rabat that featured the likes of Stevie Wonder and Kylie Minogue left at least 11 people dead, most of them women and children, police said Sunday. The incident, which also saw around 30 people injured, happened shortly after midnight (0000 GMT) Saturday on the final night of the Mawazine (Rhythms) festival, where some 70,000 spectators were at the Hay Nahda stadium to see home favourite Abdelaziz Stati sing. Police said the crowd surging towards one of the exits appeared to have brought down a wire fence, setting off the stampede as the concert ended. Five women, four men and two children were later found dead, apparently having suffocated in the crush. A source close to the case said all those who died were Moroccan. (...)
quote: 11 killed in stampede at world music festival in Morocco Sun May 24, 1:46 PM RABAT (AFP) - A stampede at a world music festival in Morocco's capital Rabat that featured the likes of Stevie Wonder and Kylie Minogue left at least 11 people dead, most of them women and children, police said Sunday. The incident, which also saw around 30 people injured, happened shortly after midnight (0000 GMT) Saturday on the final night of the Mawazine (Rhythms) festival, where some 70,000 spectators were at the Hay Nahda stadium to see home favourite Abdelaziz Stati sing. Police said the crowd surging towards one of the exits appeared to have brought down a wire fence, setting off the stampede as the concert ended. Five women, four men and two children were later found dead, apparently having suffocated in the crush. A source close to the case said all those who died were Moroccan. (...)
title: 11 die in stampede during Kylie Minogue/Stevie Wonder concert in Morocco

content: So it's not like the crowd went 'ecstatic' about Kylie, or were blown away by Li'l Stevie. That gang were probably all mellowed out in some Euro bar by the time the fellahs hit the stage. A 'world' concert without 'world' organization?
reply: So it's not like the crowd went 'ecstatic' about Kylie, or were blown away by Li'l Stevie. That gang were probably all mellowed out in some Euro bar by the time the fellahs hit the stage. A 'world' concert without 'world' organization?
title: 11 die in stampede during Kylie Minogue/Stevie Wonder concert in Morocco
